name: Lonely Tree of Hope
description: A charcoal drawing I made in 2013 during my deepest depression, but hopeful years. It symbolizes that we can grow in even the toughest environments, by being aware of the little things that feeds our soul. And always have something to hope, and look out for.  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀  ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀"Most trees have a symbiotic relationship with fungi that live on or inside their roots. On cliffs these fungi etch the rock with enzymes, breaking it down into compounds the tree can use, and channeling the nutrients directly to the tree."
